intro: Dactylostegium sparsiflorum, commonly known as the sparse-flowered dactylostegium, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
